body.p:
Carlisle Ky June 3d 1864
To his Excellency Gov. Bramblette

DrSr On the 25th Ult. Sam Job, a free man of Color of this (Nicholas) County, was tried upon a charge of having committed an assault & Battery and fined Twenty nine dollars & fifty cents & fourteen & a half days imprisonment in the County Jail and in addition to that he was put under hands to keep the peace and be of good behavior for one year He is about fifty years old -- perhaps more -- & is very poor

He is now serving out his time in Jail We the undersigned, being citizens of Nicholas County, think that under all the circumstances the punishment inflicted was unusually severe & we recommend the said Job, in an especial manner, to your Clemency and Petition you on his behalf to remit all his said ^money^ fine except the Officers' fees

Yours Truly
Thomas Kennedy
John M Dallas, Jailor
John M Chevis J. P. N. C.
Jno. A Campbell C. N. C. C
W. W. howard Deputy Clerk Nicholas Cir. Ct.
J. L. Arnold C. N. C. C.
(See over)
R. B. Riddor
Fitche Munger
Jon. H. Seeley
J. F. McMillan
A W Blair S. N. C
W. P. Ross
William Dinsmore

Nicholas County Court
vs
Sam Job
